title: SKIRITAI
content:
THE SKIRITAI (Sciritae) were a tribe of Indian men with snake-like nostrils instead of a nose and bandy,
        serpentine legs.

Pliny the Elder, Natural History 7. 25 (trans. Rackham) (Roman encyclopedia C1st
          A.D.) :
        "Megasthenes [Greek historian C4th B.C.] tells of a race among the Nomads of India that has only holes in
        the place of nostrils, like snakes, and bandy-legged; they are called the Sciritae."

A complete bibliography of the translations quoted on this page.
